author: A_Brickset_user
title: Its cool!
review: After the barracuda and the skulls eye schooner this is the best lego ship! Only a few bad things: Lego gives us only 3 cannons! but the ship has very much pieces that are very rare in my lego collection so i went to legoland Billund and found the pieces in the brickshop at least a couple of them...

author: Nased
title: Time to give this "Nice" ship a fair review!
review:
In my honest opinion, my favourite pirate ship is defnitely 6285 as that was my chidhood target and dream ship. I didn't get that as my mother think it was too expensive. So I bought this set, 6289 by myself 10 years ago when there was a sales. I got it at only $80SGD =)

That's beside the point. Well, in my honest opinion, I think this Red Beard Runner merit a 9/10. Here are the reasons. 

1) The idea of having 2 different design flags and sails is a idea that has never surfaced during the first 2 pirate ships. It acts as a decoy or deception. That is a very good idea. It's for the pirates to get closer to their preys and start their robbing. The designs and movable parts are interesting. For that, I will defenitely give it full marks in this section.

2) Sad to say, there are only 7 figurines. I love LEGO and of cos, the more figurines, the better it is. 7 is lesser than 6285(8 pirates) and 6286(9 pirates). But Red Beard Runner is the smallest of the three and hence I think 7 pirates are just ok for the boat size. The good point is the pirates have new costumes. That deserves some credits.

3) Plenty of weapons. There are enough swords, so many that all pirates can hold one each and there are enough pistols and rifles for everyone too. The arsenal of weapons is sufficient and I think it is better than all the soldier ships. Therefore, I don't see why this cool ship should be given a review worse than any other soldier ships.

4) Some complain that the design is awful. Honestly I wouldn't buy this if it had a design similar to the previous 2. What's so bad about the design? If LEGO players can accept the weird and funny designs from the Bionix or those Space series, then all the more I think this 6289 is quite innovative.

Therefore, I seriously think that this set is cool. Though not perfect, it definitely merits a 9/10. But since it has suffered "unjustified" cristicisms for so many months, I am willing to rate it 5/5 in Brickset. It's really a great addition to the collection of Pirates Ships.

author: StormSworder
title: Looks nice, but sadly nowhere near as good as the first two big pirate ships.
review:
I would say that this is a pirate ship for people who like to play at pirates rather than have fun building the sets or appreciating lego models.  It is by far the lesser of the three large pirate ships in the original 1980s-1990s Lego Pirates run.

 

One of the main problems I have is that the ship seems to have been designed very much with a "collapsing" theme in mind.  The mast falls to one side, which is an original feature I'll admit.  But the lever under the bridge (used to fling the wheel and presumably the man sailing it) means that the rear end of the ship is empty.  No captain's cabin, map room, or anything like that.  Also, the cannons have nothing to secure them, and pirates having to pick up a cannon to turn it round seems kind of a bad design. 

 

Another problem is the way the masts are constructed.  This set uses a piece which is basically a length of string with a "one-stud round brick" structure at each end.  These are not proper lego, are made of cheap plastic which cracks very easily.  Due to the way you're expected to construct the sails, with the strings stretched very tightly, the studs at the ends of these strings will often refuse to stay attached together.

 

Overall the ship looks nice, makes use of some curved pieces, but it has some design flaws which should have been looked at before release.

author: sudorum
title: Pirates:Ye be warned
review: the only lego pirate set i own, it is very detailed and useable. First off, it comes with many great minifigures, including a parrot, a monkey, and the the peg legged captain. the ship itself includes serveral cannons that can be positioned thruout the ship, a mast that lowers through a trap door system, and a lego compass that actually works! the platform the captain stays on "explodes" by removing two pegs. the most detailed part of this ship is on the back, which is greatly constructed giant skull face.

author: CCOOK
title: Not bad
review: This is a nice set for people who like to actually play with LEGO sets, since it has a collapsible mast and stern.  It is not nearly as large as either 6285 or 6286, both of which are much better sets, but it does have a unique red hull and a nice-looking cabin.  The ship has only two middle section plates so its stripped hull is 8 studs shorter than the previous two pirate ships.  I actually used this ship to build what I think is a little bit nicer version with better rigging (ropes, etc.) and no collapsible parts.

author: Crazybrick45
title: One of the best ships in the classic Pirate line!
review:
This set is great. Great design, good figs, and overall has to be one of the best ships in the LEGO classic pirates line! So, let's get to the pros and cons.

Pros:
7 figures, but you can hold WAY more.
The cabin tilts down by pulling 2 pins. 
Mast tilts sideways by pulling out a board. 
Has a rowboat hooked onto the back by a rope. 
Crane system with a net to hold the shark. 
MONKEY!!

Cons:
Cannons don't actually fire. 
The pin under the tilting mast won't work if you put it in the wrong place which is easy to do.

Overall great set. Get it if you can't get the Barracuda, Brickbeard's Bounty, or any other of those big ships.

author: SirSven7
title: Lego Steve's Review
review:
The ship features a back that can fall off and a mast that can lean to the side, my question is why are these features needed, Lego in and of itself is a construction toy, why do we need to have a feature to show destruction when you can simply destroy it and make it up again, Lego you have missed the fundamental joy of what you are.

What is the cost of having this magic feature? No Cabin, we have a large ship but no cabin for its mighty captain. To hammer the final nail home in the coffin that is the Red Beard Runner, we have the sails, a ship this large and we only get one sail per mast (it’s usually two) and it’s ripped, dreadful. On the plus side we get a nice variation of minifigs and two black bandanas, which I believe are very rare.

But if the best thing I can say for a ship is that we have black bandanas then it does not look good. Compared to the previous two ships, this is a big letdown.

If you like this review click on the link to find it and all reviews of the pirate sets

http://legosteveblog.blogspot.com/2011/04/lego-pirate-wave-4-1996-1997.html

author: theotherkevin
title: Great Set, Bad Pirate Ship
review:
This was one of the first Lego sets I ever had, and probably the first serious build I ever did.  As a set, this one is great.  The minifigs, animals and features are very cool and the gimmicks make it a great play toy.  Unfortunately, it belongs in the classic Pirates collection.  This collection had some of the best sets in Lego history, 2 of which are the flagship (no pun intended) Black Seas Barracuda and Skulls Eye Schooner.  Compared to these sets, this one just isn't up to snuff.  The falling mast and wreckable stern are neat, but you lose a cabin and a few sails for some tricks, which isn't good for a building toy.  This set had the potential to be another classic, but the opportunity was wasted for some fancy gimmick design.

However, I still enjoyed this set very much and recently handed it down to my nephew, who just discovered Legos.  He had a ton of fun putting together the classic set, but we decided to cannibalize some parts to enhance the Schooner he inherited from his parents. The remains are now part of a shipwreck I helped him put together.  If you can get your hands on this for a good price, and already have one or two of the other classic pirate ships, get this.  Otherwise the set is a bit of a letdown.

Pros

  • Rowboat, cannons, treasure and weapons.
  • Great selection of classic Pirates minifigs.
  • Nice color scheme.
  • Nifty mast and cabin destruction gimmicks
  • Parts great for other Pirate sets.
  • Great for rounding out collections

Cons

  • Gimmicks detract from the set.
  • Compared to other pirate ships, this is only good for the parts.
  • Only good for collectors and really devoted fans. Or if you really need the parts.

Ultimately this set is a bit of a letdown, compared to the other ships released on the same line. It still holds a special place in my heart, but I was glad to see it off with it's brethren with another generation of Lego lovers.

author: mstratton28
title: The longer I look at this set the more I appreciate it.
review:
I picked this set up a few weeks ago to round out my pirate ship collection. I remember when this set was released, I received the Armada Flagship as a gift as the larger ships were too expensive for “Santa”. 

I disliked this set when it came out as the battle-damage-exploding-whatever gimmick wasn't for me. This, plus the transition away from the Imperial Guards pushed younger me towards the Western theme. 

So COVID-19 forced me to find new ways to entertain myself, and buying the old pirate ship sets has been one of them. This was the last set I needed to purchase, I was even thinking about skipping it.

I'm glad I didn't. I've realized that with each ship the designers always tried new ways to build the same parts of the ship. The rudders, masts/rigging, cabin and cannon layout were always different from set to set. Sometimes that is great, other times it didn't work for me (they could have put the little wheels on the cannons for each set and not had them slide on the tiles). 

Pros

  • I like the color. Each pirate ship has a unique color palette and this set is no exception. 
  • Good collection of minifigs. It includes a shark, monkey and parrot.
  • The completed set looks really nice. 
  • The sail setup uses the tow-ball configuration and not the technic setup in later sets (I really loved this setup as a child)
  • I love the way you can raise the sails by pulling on the strings. It blew my mind the first time I did it. It is the little things that amuse me.

Cons

  • It had to follow the Black Seas Barracuda and the Skulls Eye Schooner.
  • The front mast rigging doesn't go all the way down to the deck. I know this was due to the collapsing mast, but it looks silly.
  • The sails are too high and too few. Again, this is probably due to the collapsing mast design. 
  • 3 cannons? Really? There are 4 sets of tracks for cannon and you only included 3?
  • The rudder is so simple it is an afterthought.

Overall, I appreciate what they were trying to do, but there were a few design details that I just didn't like, and they all seem to be because of the battle-damage-exploding-whatever gimmick. The rudder was small because there had to be enough room for the cabin to fall. The sails were small and the rigging didn't extend all the way down because they had to have room for the mast to collapse. 

This set has grown on me. It's definitely not my favorite, but not my least favorite either.
